result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jamie S Hofmeister was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 187 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine is to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

DNA surcharge, Blood draw fee and Transcript fee are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.    Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of New Berlin Police Department.  Transcript fee to be paid to the Waukesha County District Attorney's Office.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of extended supervision.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt:
Certified Copy of Order Originally Docketed on 03/02/17.
Jamie S. Hofmeister appeals from a judgment of conviction for operating a motor vehicle while under the influence (OWI) as a fourth offense in five years and from an order denying her motion for postconviction relief.  Her appellate counsel has filed  a no-merit report pursuant to WIS STAT RULE 809.32.  Hofmeister received a copy of the report, was advised of her right to file a response, and has elected not to do so.  Upon consideration of the report and an independant review of the record, we conclude that the judgment and order may be summarily affirmed because ther is no arguable merit to any issue that could be raised on appeal.

IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction and order are summarily affirmed.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Atty. Becky Van Dam is relieved from further representing Jamie S. Hofmeister in this appeal.
records.descr: Court of Appeals decision & order affirming

records.addlTxt: Court of Appeals summarily affirmed with attached decision dated March 1, 2017 from Court of Appeals.

Order Denying - Defense Postcoviction Motion for Ineffectiveness of Counsel.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus on 10/18/16.
From Taycheedah Correctional.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Barry Braatz and ADA Abbie Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jamie S Hofmeister in court, in custody (by video conference from Taycheedah), with attorney Becky N Van Dam.    
Oral Ruling On:
Postconviction Motion filed by Defense - Ineffectiveness of Counsel (Machner Issue - Allow the defendant to withdraw her plea).


Court finds/orders the following:  Reasons placed on the record.
Issue was brought up regarding procedural deficiencies of the blood draw warrant.
Court finds the blood warrant was properly issued, and there was sufficient probable cause for the issuance of the blood warrant.
Therefore, any Motion brought would have been denied (no basis for suppression).
Court finds there was not ineffectiveness counsel and the conviction stands.
Court Denies the Postconviction Motion.

Extended Supervision: 2.5 Years.
187 Days Credit.

36 Months D/L REVOCATION: 
36 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK: 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
